info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 9 at 1:40PM CDT until September 10 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall Monday morning continues.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following county, Mitchell.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is still occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar, automated rain gauges, and a few public reports confirmed that as much as 4 to 10 inches of rain fell within the Warning area Monday morning. Although water levels will continue to gradually recede in parts of the Warning area, flooding will likely continue into Wednesday in some places. Of particular concern is the Salt Creek area in far southern Mitchell County, where flooding continues slightly downstream of Mitchell County at Barnard, Kansas. There is the potential for additional rainfall late tonight into Wednesday morning, but confidence in amounts in not high. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt Creek, Fifth Creek, and Fourth Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of southeastern Mitchell County near Salt Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT WEDNESDAY
